page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY LANCING 1934
page.content: We interviewed Mrs.Bonetti who moved to Lancing in 1934.Lancing was made up of three shops and some houses and nurseries.The road in which the library and health centre now stand was a track.Two Victorian houses stood here.One was demolished the other named Penstone house.During the Spanish Civil War the Basque children were sent there,later it was made into an hotel.During the Second World War concrete blocks were built along the seafront as defence.People were not allowed on the beach because of the danger of mines.When asked Mrs.Bonetti said that she thought the main changes in Lancing were the vast explosion in people and houses since the late 1930s New industries have come to Lancing since the 1960's bringing even more people into the area to work. By Cathy and Zoe,IRENE AVE C.MIDDLE SCHOOL.
